core

Class AbstractSingleProblem

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.AbstractComponent
      • core.AbstractProblem
        • core.AbstractSingleProblem

  • public abstract class AbstractSingleProblem
extends AbstractProblem
    Provides a general interface to formulate own problems that evaluates a single representations at a time. By evaluating a candidate a corresponding fitness value must be calculated and returned.

    In order to provide a visualized evaluation the method replayWithVisualization(core.AbstractRepresentation) must be overwritten.

    To support requirement changes based on different parameters override the following method:

    -AbstractProblem.adjustRequirements(java.util.Hashtable, java.util.Hashtable)

    Author:
    Istvan Fehervari

      • AbstractSingleProblem

    • Method Detail

      • replayWithVisualization

        public void replayWithVisualization(AbstractRepresentation candidate)
        This function is called when the user request a visual replay from the problem. A total re-evaluation is not needed, only to provide a visual mean for the user to grasp the performance of the indicated candidate solution.

        It is recommended to use advanced threading for display like SwingWorker.

        Parameters:
        candidate - The candidate whose replay has been requested.

      • evaluateFitness

        public final double evaluateFitness(AbstractRepresentation candidate)
        Evaluates the given representation by calculating its corresponding fitness value. A higher fitness means better performance.
        Parameters:
        candidate - The candidate solution to be evaluated.
        Returns:
        the corresponding fitness value.

      • getMaximumFitness

        public abstract double getMaximumFitness()
        Returns the achievable maximum fitness of this problem. A representations with this fitness value cannot be improved any further.

      • getNoveltyVector

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Float> getNoveltyVector(AbstractRepresentation candidate,
                                                    boolean assignfitness)
                                                      throws sun.reflect.generics.reflectiveObjects.NotImplementedException
        Returns the novelty vector for the given candidate representation. Assigns the corresponding fitness value if requested.
        Throws:
        sun.reflect.generics.reflectiveObjects.NotImplementedException
